pages.title: Page 1
pages.text: Once there was a man and a woman. They had very little gold. They lived in a small hut by the road. One day, they found a goose. "Let us keep it," said the woman. "We can sell its eggs."

pages.title: Page 2
pages.text: The next morning, the woman went to check on the goose. She gasped! There was an egg. But it was not white. It was gold! "Look!" she cried. "A golden egg!" They sold the gold egg. They bought food and a new coat.

pages.title: Page 3
pages.text: Every day, the goose laid one golden egg. Just one. The man and woman would sell it. Slowly, they got more and more gold. They bought new clothes. They fixed their hut. They had plenty to eat. Life was good!

pages.title: Page 4
pages.text: But soon, the man got greedy. "We only get one egg a day!" he said. "That is too slow! I want all the gold at once!" "Let's cut open the goose," he said. "All the golden eggs must be inside!" The woman did not know if this was a good idea. But she agreed.

pages.title: Page 5
pages.text: They caught the goose. They cut it open. But inside? There was nothing. No golden eggs. Just an ordinary goose. Now the goose was dead. It could not lay any more golden eggs. Not even one. The man and woman had nothing. Their greed cost them everything.

pages.title: Page 6
pages.text: The man and woman sat by the road. They were sad. "We should have been patient," said the woman. "We had one golden egg every day. Now we have none." They learned a lesson that day: Don't be greedy. Be grateful for what you have.

pages.title: Page 7
pages.text: If they had waited, the goose would have given them one golden egg every day. Slow and steady is better than trying to get everything at once. Greed can make you lose it all.
